para: Each &skel; maintains a stack of previous &elem; selections. Whenever &elems; are selected or deselected, a new version is pushed onto the stack. The Undo command pops the latest version off of the stack, thereby reverting to the previously selected set of &elems;. The popped set is not destroyed &emdash; it can be recovered with the command.
The selection stack is not infinite. When it is full, the oldest selection will be lost when a new selection is made. The size of the stack can be changed with or .
